chapters.title: Introduction to the Course & Prehistoric Medicine
Medicine in Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia
Greco-Roman Medicine
chapters.description: Hippocrates (Father of Medicine), Four Humors theory, bloodletting, Herophilus/Erasistratus (anatomy/physiology pioneers), Asclepeions, Hippocratic Oath, Pedanius Dioscorides (De Materia Medica), Galen (humoral rebalancing, gladiator observations), Roman public health/sanitation, surgical tools/prosthetics/dentistry

chapters.title: The Medical Traditions of India and Middle East
chapters.description: Ayurveda (holistic system, five elements, three doshas Vata/Pitta/Kapha, srotas channels, agni metabolism), Susruta Samhita (surgery), Charaka Samhita (internal medicine), Islamic Golden Age medicine, Al-Rhazi (smallpox/measles distinction), Al-Zahrawi (surgical instruments), Ibn al-Nafis (pulmonary circulation), Ibn Sina/Avicenna (Canon of Medicine), Ibn al-Baytar (pharmacology)

chapters.title: The Medical Traditions of America and Africa
chapters.description: Alchemy (Chinese/Egyptian/Islamic traditions, Zosimos, Jabir ibn Hayyan's element classification, mercury/sulfur compounds), Native North American medicine (balance philosophy, willow bark/salicylate, sage), Aztec/Mayan medicine (Ah'men, pulque, obsidian, curare, coca), African herbalism (Securidaca violet tree, Momordica pumpkin, Prunus africana), West Asian medicine (frankincense, mastic resin, gum arabic)

chapters.title: Renaissance: The Rise of Scientific Medicine-I
chapters.description: European Dark Ages medicine, Salerno medical school (Alfanus I, Constantine the African), Vesalius' anatomical revolution (De Humani Corporis Fabrica, Basel Skeleton), Renaissance anatomists (Falloppio, Eustachius), barber-surgeons, Ambroise Paré's surgical innovations (ligatures, wound balms, prosthetics)

chapters.title: Renaissance: The Rise of Scientific Medicine-II
chapters.description: William Harvey's circulation discovery (double circulation, De Motu Cordis, ligature experiments), Ibn al-Nafis (pulmonary circulation), Marcello Malpighi (capillaries, microscopical anatomy), Thomas Sydenham (English Hippocrates, disease classification, clinical observation), reconstructive surgery history (Susruta rhinoplasty, Tagliacozzi, von Gräfe), microscope development (Janssen, Hooke's Micrographia/cell term, Leeuwenhoek's animalcules, Cohn's bacterial classification)

chapters.title: Medical Branches of the Industrial Age
chapters.description: Microscope evolution (Leeuwenhoek's animalcules, Hooke's 'cell' term, Malpighi's capillaries/histology, Cohn's bacterial classification), histopathology (Müller 1838, Golgi/Cajal 1906 Nobel), cellular pathology (Virchow 1858), anesthesia revolution (Morton ether 1846, Simpson chloroform 1847, local/spinal anesthesia), antiseptic/aseptic surgery (Semmelweis handwashing 1847, Lister carbolic acid 1865, Macewen steam sterilization, rubber gloves 1897), neurology founding (Charcot, Macewen brain tumor 1878)

chapters.title: Global Pandemics and Therapeutics-I
chapters.description: Historical pandemics (Athens 430 BCE, Justinian 542 CE, Black Death 1347–1351), plague transmission (Yersinia pestis, rat fleas), buboes symptomatology, quarantine origin (Venice 40 days), plague doctor costumes/miasma theory, Americas demographic collapse (smallpox/measles), cinchona bark/quinine for malaria, smallpox history/eradication (al-Razi differentiation, Lady Montagu variolation, Jenner vaccination 1796, WHO campaign 1967–1980)
